newsitem.title: AUSTRALIA: RTRS-Trend retail worst since 1962-Australia Opp'n.
newsitem.headline: RTRS-Trend retail worst since 1962-Australia Opp'n.

text.p: Australian opposition treasury spokesman Gareth Evans said on Monday the fall in trend retail sales in October was the first time trend figures had dropped for two months in a row since 1962.

"This is the first time trend retail sales have fallen for two months in a row since the ABS (Australian Bureau of Statistics) started collecting figures in 1962," Evans said in a statement. Retail sales fell to A$10.23 billion in trend terms in October, down from A$10.24 billion in the previous month.
Evans said that given the recent volatility in the seasonally adjusted figures, it was appropriate to focus on the trend figures.
Retail sales rose 1.4 percent to A$10.20 billion in October, in seasonally-adjusted terms, after falling 3.7 percent to A$10.05 billion in September.
"Today's retail sales figures offer little hope of an immediate pick-up in the economy," Evans said.
